title: SEMI C33-0301 SPECIFICATIONS FOR n-METHYL 2-PYRROLIDONE - # 10.4  Trace Metal Analysis
content: 10.4.1  The following method has giv en satisfactory results in determining metal ion impurities at the values specified for each of the following metals: aluminum (Al), antimony (Sb), arsenic (As), boron (B), calcium $\mathrm { ( C a ) }$ , chromium $( \mathrm { C r } )$ , copper $\mathbf { \left( C u \right) }$ , gold (Au), iron (Fe), lead $( \mathrm { P b } )$ , magnesium $( \mathbf { M g } )$ , manganese (Mn), nickel (Ni), potassium (K), sodium $\mathrm { ( N a ) }$ , tin $( \mathsf { S } \mathsf { n } )$ , titanium $\mathrm { ( T i ) }$ , and zinc $( Z \boldsymbol { \mathrm { n } } )$ . Alternate methods may be used as long as appropriate studies demonstrate a recovery between $7 5 \mathrm { - } 1 2 5 \%$ of a known sample spike for half of the value of each specified element.

title: SEMI C33-0301 SPECIFICATIONS FOR n-METHYL 2-PYRROLIDONE - # 10.4.2  Special Reagents
content:
10.4.2.1  Nitric Acid, Ultra Pure — Use nitric acid specified for low metal ion content.  
10.4.2.2  Water — The water used for a ll the dilution, calibration, and standards should meet, at a minimum, the criteria for Type E1.1 in ASTM D5127 in regard to cation analysis.

title: SEMI C33-0301 SPECIFICATIONS FOR n-METHYL 2-PYRROLIDONE - # 10.4.3  Sample Preparation
content: 10.4.3.1  In a $1 0 0 ~ \mathrm { m L }$ volumetric, add $2 0 ~ \mathrm { m L }$ of sample and fill to the mark such that the final solution contains $2 \%$ nitric acid.

title: SEMI C33-0301 SPECIFICATIONS FOR n-METHYL 2-PYRROLIDONE - # 10.4.4  Standard Preparation
content: 10.4.4.1  Four standards are prepared such that the final solution contains $2 \%$ nitric acid (i.e., $2 \%$ of $70 \%$ nitric acid vol/vol) and $20 \%$ vol/vol sample. The four standards are 0.5, 1, 5, and $1 0 \mathrm { p p b }$ .

title: SEMI C33-0301 SPECIFICATIONS FOR n-METHYL 2-PYRROLIDONE - # 10.4.5  Analysis
content:
10.4.5.1  This is a method of standard addition procedure. Using the prepared solutions, analyze the  
elements by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP/MS).  
10.4.5.2  Hot plasma conditions with sh ield are used for the following elements: Ti, Mn, Ni, Cu, As, Sb, Sn, Au, and Pb.  
10.4.5.3  Cold plasma conditions with s hield are used for the follow elements, B, Na, Mg, Al, K, Ca, Cr, Fe, and $Z \mathrm { n }$ .

title: SEMI C34-0699SPECIFICATION AND GUIDELINE FOR MIXED ACID ETCHANTS
content: This specification and this guideline were technically approved by the Global Process Chemicals Committee and are the direct responsibility of the North American Process Chemicals Committee.  Current edition approved by the North American Regional Standards Committee on April 23, 1999.  Initially available on SEMI OnLine May 1999; to be published June 1999.  This document replaces SEMI C2.1 and C7.19 in their entirety.  Originally published in 1981 and 1995 respectively.

title: SEMI C34-0699SPECIFICATION AND GUIDELINE FOR MIXED ACID ETCHANTS - # 1  Purpose
content: 1.1  The purpose of this document is to standardize requirements for mixed acid etchants used in the semiconductor industry and testing procedures to support those standards. Test methods have been shown to give statistically valid results. This document also provides guidelines for grades of mixed acid etchants for which a need has been identified. In the case of the guidelines, the test methods may not have been statistically validated yet.

title: SEMI C34-0699SPECIFICATION AND GUIDELINE FOR MIXED ACID ETCHANTS - # 2  Scope
content: 2.1  The scope of this document is all grades of mixed acid etchants used in the semiconductor industry.

title: SEMI C34-0699SPECIFICATION AND GUIDELINE FOR MIXED ACID ETCHANTS - # 3  Limitations
content: 3.1  None.

title: SEMI C34-0699SPECIFICATION AND GUIDELINE FOR MIXED ACID ETCHANTS - # 4  Referenced Documents
content: SEMI C1 — Specifications for Reagents SEMI C2 — Specifications for Etchants

title: SEMI C34-0699SPECIFICATION AND GUIDELINE FOR MIXED ACID ETCHANTS - # 5  Terminology
content: mixed acid etchant — any combination of nitric, hydrofluoric, and acetic acids with the relative composition expressed in terms of volumes of $70 \%$ nitric acid, $49 \%$ hydrofluoric acid, and glacial acetic acid, respectively. In the expression, all the relative volumes shall be reduced to a ratio of the smallest whole numbers. For example, a 3:1:2 mixed acid etchant would imply a mixture of 3 volumes of $70 \%$ nitric acid, 1 volume of $49 \%$ hydrofluoric acid, and 2 volumes of glacial acetic acid. If a component is absent, its relative volume shall be taken as zero. For example, a 3:1:0 mixed acid etchant would imply that no acetic acid is present.

title: SEMI C34-0699SPECIFICATION AND GUIDELINE FOR MIXED ACID ETCHANTS - # 6  Composition
content:
6.1  The content of each of the com ponents of a mixed acid etchant shall be expressed on a weight/weight basis of the $100 \%$ acids in the total mixture. For the volumeto-weight conversion, the densities shall be taken as 1.415, $1 . 1 5 3 ~ \mathrm { g / m L }$ , and $1 . 0 5 0 ~ \mathrm { g / m L }$ for $70 \%$ nitric acid,  
$49 \%$ hydrofluoric acid, and glacial acetic acid, respectively.

Cool, and transfer quantitatively to a $5 0 ~ \mathrm { m L }$ volumetric flask using $2 \%$ nitric acid for rinsing and dilution to volume. Run a reagent blank.

content: 8.7.5.1  Using the acid sample and reag ent blank, analyze group 1 elements by flame atomic absorption spectroscopy and all other elements by plasma emission spectroscopy.

title: SEMI C35-0301 SPECIFICATIONS AND GUIDELINE FOR NITRIC ACID - # 9.2.2  Special Reagents
content:
9.2.2.1  Nitric Acid, Ultra Pure — Use nitric acid specified for low metal ion content.  
9.2.2.2 $7 . 0 \%$ Nitric Acid Solution — D ilute $2 0 \mathrm { ~ g ~ }$ of ultrapure nitric acid to $2 0 0 ~ \mathrm { g }$ using water meeting the criteria for Type E1.1 in ASTM D5127.  
9.2.2.3  Water — The water used for a ll the dilution, calibration and standards should meet at a minimum the criteria for Type E1.1 in ASTM D5127 in regard to cation analysis.  
9.2.2.4  Indium Internal Standard — Make up a indium internal standard solution to a concentration of $2 0 \ \mathrm { \mu g / m L }$ (ppm) from a appropriate concentrated indium standard solution.

title: SEMI C35-0301 SPECIFICATIONS AND GUIDELINE FOR NITRIC ACID - # 9.2.3  Sample Preparation
content: 9.2.3.1  In a clean environment, place $2 . 0 0 \ \mathrm { g }$ of sample into a tared FEP bottle $( 3 0 ~ \mathrm { m L } )$ ), dilute with Type E1.1 water to a final weight of $2 0 . 0 \ \mathrm { g }$ . Add $2 0 ~ \mu \mathrm { L }$ of the indium internal standard solution. Run a reagent blank.

title: SEMI C35-0301 SPECIFICATIONS AND GUIDELINE FOR NITRIC ACID - # 9.2.4  Analysis
content: 9.2.4.1  Using the prepared solutions a nd blanks, analyze sodium, potassium, calcium and iron by graphite furnace atomic absorption (GFAA) and the remaining elements by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP/MS). For calibration, the standards are made up with the $7 . 0 \%$ nitric acid solution and the indium internal standard such that the final concentration is $2 0 \mathrm { n g / g }$ of indium.

title: SEMI C35-0301 SPECIFICATIONS AND GUIDELINE FOR NITRIC ACID - # 15  Tier B Procedures
content: 15.1  Standardized test methods are being developed for all parameters at the purity levels indicated. Until standardized test methods are published, test methodology shall be determined by user and producer. The Process Chemical Committee considers a test method to be valid only if there is a documented recovery study showing a recovery of $7 5 \mathrm { - } 1 2 5 \%$ . Recovery is for a known sample spike at $50 \%$ of the specified level.

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID
content: This specification was technically approved by the global Liquid Chemicals Committee.  This edition was approved for publication by the global Audits and Reviews Subcommittee on April 7, 2005.  It was available at www.semi.org in June 2005 and on CD-ROM in July 2005.  Originally published in 1981; previously published March 2001.

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 1  Purpose
content: 1.1  The purpose of this document is to standardize requirements for phosphoric acid used in the semiconductor industry and testing procedures to support those standards.  Test methods have been shown to give statistically valid results.

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 2  Scope
content:
2.1  The scope of this document is all grades of phosphoric acid used in the semiconductor industry.  
2.2  This standard does not purport to address safety issues, if any, associated with its use.  It is the responsibility of the users of this standard to establish appropriate safety and health practices and determine the applicability of regulatory limitations prior to use.

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 3  Limitations
content: 3.1  None.

Set a spectrophotometer at $4 1 0 ~ \mathrm { n m }$ and, using $1 \ \mathrm { c m }$ cells, adjust the instrument to read zero absorbance with Blank Solution C in the light path. Then determine the absorbance of Sample Solution A. Adjust the instrument to read zero absorbance with Sample Solution A in the light path and determine the absorbance of Control Solution B. The absorbance of Sample Solution A should not exceed that of Control Solution B.

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 8.4  Sulfate
content:
8.4.1  The following inductively coupled plasma (ICP) method has given satisfactory results for the determination of sulfate $\mathrm { ( S O _ { 4 } ) }$ by the analysis of sulfur (S) and subsequent calculation to determine the stoichiometric equivalent of sulfate.  
NOTE 2:  While this method has been shown to accurately determine sulfate concentration in phosphoric acid, the ICP methodology actually evaluates sulfur.  Therefore, other sulfur species (organic, etc.) will also be determined by this method, and the “calculated” sulfate value may be higher than the actual sulfate concentration in a given sample.

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 8.4.2  Special Reagents
content:
8.4.2.1  Water — The water used for all dilution, calibration and standards should meet at a minimum, the criteria for Type E1.1 in ASTM D5127.  
8.4.2.2  Scandium Internal Standard — A scandium standard solution is utilized such that final diluted samples will have a scandium concentration of $4 0 \mathrm { p p m }$ .

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 8.4.3  Sample Preparation
content: 8.4.3.1  Dilute $2 0 ~ \mathrm { g }$ of phosphoric acid to $1 0 0 ~ \mathrm { { m L } }$ with water.  (An aliquot of the concentrated scandium standard solution should also be added during the dilution process such that the final diluted sample will have a scandium concentration of $4 0 \mathrm { p p m } .$ .)

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 8.4.4  Analysis
content: 8.4.4.1  Using the prepared sample, analyze the sulfur content using inductively coupled plasma (ICP) spectroscopy that has been standardized using appropriate sulfur standard solutions.  A wavelength of $1 8 0 . 7 3 1 \ \mathrm { n m }$ has been shown to give satisfactory results.

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 8.4.5  Calculation
content: 8.4.5.1  The associated sulfate $\mathrm { ( S O _ { 4 } ) }$ concentration is determined using the stoichiometric conversion $\mathrm { S O } _ { 4 } = 3 \times \mathrm { S }$ ).

title: SEMI C36-0705 SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHOSPHORIC ACID - # 8.5  Trace Metal Analysis
content: 8.5.1  The following method has given satisfactory results in determining trace metal impurities at the value specified for each of the following trace metals: arsenic (As), gold (Au), cobalt $\scriptstyle ( \mathbf { C o } )$ , chromium $( \mathrm { C r } )$ , nickel (Ni), lead $( \mathrm { P b } )$ , and antimony (Sb). Alternate methods may be used as long as they are validated for each trace metal according to SEMI C1, ‘Method Validation’.

title: SEMI C37-0699SPECIFICATION FOR PHOSPHORIC ETCHANTS - # 1  Purpose
content: 1.1  The purpose of this document is to standardize requirements for phosphoric etchants used in the semiconductor industry and testing procedures to support those standards. Test methods have been shown to give statistically valid results. This document also provides guidelines for grades of phosphoric etchants for which a need has been identified. In the case of the guidelines, the test methods may not have been statistically validated yet.

title: SEMI C37-0699SPECIFICATION FOR PHOSPHORIC ETCHANTS - # 2  Scope
content: 2.1  The scope of this document is all grades of phosphoric etchants used in the semiconductor industry.

title: SEMI C37-0699SPECIFICATION FOR PHOSPHORIC ETCHANTS - # 5  Terminology
content: 5.1  phosphoric etchant — any com bination of phosphoric, nitric, and acetic acids with the relative composition expressed in terms of $8 5 \%$ phosphoric acid, $70 \%$ nitric acid, and glacial acetic acid, respectively. In the expression, all the relative volumes shall be reduced to a ratio of the smallest whole numbers. For example, a 16:1:2 phosphoric etchant would imply a mixture of 16 volumes of $8 5 \%$ phosphoric acid, 1 volume of $70 \%$ nitric acid, and 2 volumes of glacial acetic acid. If a component is absent, its relative volume shall be taken as zero. For example, a 16:1:0 phosphoric etchant implies that no acetic acid is present.

Content: 6.1 The content of each of the com ponents of a phosphoric etchant shall be expressed on a weight/ weight basis of the 100 percent acid in the total mixture. For the volume-to-weight conversion, the densities shall be taken as 1.695, 1.415, and $1 . 0 5 0 ~ \mathrm { g / m L }$ for $8 5 \%$ phosphoric acid, $70 \%$ nitric acid, and glacial acetic acid, respectively. 9.2 Phosphoric Acid — Weigh acc urately 2.5 to $3 . 0 ~ \mathrm { g }$ of sample in a tared weighing bottle. Quantitatively transfer the sample with 40 to $6 0 ~ \mathrm { m L }$ of water into a platinum or polyfluorocarbon dish. Evaporate the solution on a steam bath in a hood (1 to 2 hours). title: SEMI C38-0699 GUIDELINE FOR PHOSPHORUS OXYCHLORIDE - # 1  Purpose
content: 1.1  The purpose of this document is to standardize requirements for phosphorus oxychloride used in the semiconductor industry and testing procedures to support those standards. Test methods have been shown to give statistically valid results. This document also provides guidelines for grades of phosphorus oxychloride for which a need has been identified. In the case of the guidelines, the test methods may not have been statistically validated yet.

content: This specification was technically approved by the Global Process Chemicals Committee and is the direct responsibility of the North American Process Chemicals Committee.  Current edition approved by the North American Regional Standards Committee on April 23, 1999.  Initially available on SEMI OnLine May 1999; to be published June 1999.  This document replaces SEMI C1.14 in its entirety.  Originally published in 1978.

title: SEMI C39-0699 SPECIFICATION FOR POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE PELLETS - # 1  Purpose
content: 1.1  The purpose of this document is to standardize requirements for potassium hydroxide pellets used in the semiconductor industry and testing procedures to support those standards. Test methods have been shown to give statistically valid results. This document also provides guidelines for grades of potassium hydroxide pellets for which a need has been identified. In the case of the guidelines, the test methods may not have been statistically validated yet.

title: SEMI C39-0699 SPECIFICATION FOR POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE PELLETS - # 2  Scope
content: 2.1  The scope of this document is all grades of potassium hydroxide pellets used in the semiconductor industry.

content: 3.1  None.

title: SEMI C40-0699 SPECIFICATION FOR POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE, $45 \%$ SOLUTION - # 1  Purpose
content: 1.1  The purpose of this document is to standardize requirements for $45 \%$ potassium hydroxide solution used in the semiconductor industry and testing procedures to support those standards. Test methods have been shown to give statistically valid results. This document also provides guidelines for grades of potassium hydroxide, $45 \%$ solution for which a need has been identified. In the case of the guidelines, the test methods may not have been statistically validated yet.

content: 2.1  The scope of this document is all grades of $45 \%$ potassium hydroxide solution used in the semiconductor industry.
